attributes.action: consider expanding the number of "Shared Space" traffic management projects in the UK.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The results from work carried out in relation to Kensington High Street speak for themselves: Pedestrian accidents in the affected area have been reduced by more than 40 per cent. 
The people ask that the British Government take a close look at the work carried out in other countries, especially in Holland. "It encapsulates a new philosophy and set of principles for the design, management and maintenance of streets and public spaces, based on the integration of traffic with other forms of human activity. The most recognizable characteristic of shared space is the absence of conventional traffic signals, signs, road markings, humps and barriers - all the clutter essential to the highway."
